item.title: Deborah add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Deborah add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I am the Lorax. I speak for the trees. I speak for the trees for the trees have no tongues." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll
